key_mistakes.reason: This move leaves the knight vulnerable and disrupts the pawn structure.
This move fails to address the threat on the b2 pawn.
Misses the opportunity to defend the pawn structure.
The move allows the opponent to gain control of the a-file.
Weakens the d4 pawn and opens up lines for opponent's pieces.
The knight is misused, leading to a disjointed position.
Allows the opponent to strengthen their pawn structure.
Misses the opportunity for a tactical check.
Weakens the pawn structure around the king without any gain.
Puts the knight in a vulnerable position.
Misses an opportunity to capture a more valuable piece.

recommendations: Focus on maintaining a solid pawn structure to avoid weaknesses.
Ensure pieces are actively placed and not unnecessarily exposed.
Consider king safety during exchanges and avoid weakening pawn shields.
Control the center with pawns and pieces to dictate the pace of the game.
Look for tactical opportunities to gain material advantage or improve position.
